I am Hiro, who is passionate about data science and computer science. I am also a member of 200Words.



Motivation

Through explaining the concept, theories, technologies, technique, and tools to myself and others in this blog, I would like to deepen my knowledge and expertise (following the lessons from Learn Better and Feynman Technique).


Coding Problem

"Compare yourself with who you were yesterday"

I did not take any formal computer science education and started to reseach about machine learning. However, I felt coding problems e.g., algorithms and data structure would be the fundamental skill for data science as well.

Every Sturday I join LeetCode Weekly Contest and deepen my understanding by explaining some problems that I could not solve nicely. I know there are a lot of better code in the world but I progress day by day by comparing myself who I was yesterday.

Machine Learning

"The best way to learn is to teach"

At the Univerisity of Sheffield I have been involved with teaching:

  • Undergraduate mathematics: set theory, calculus, analysis, mechanics, and differential equations,
  • Scientific programming: Python, R, Latex, and html.

I enjoy the difficult task of making complex concepts understandable.

200 Words a Day

"Writing is never easy"

I write regularly about what I do (solar physics research) and what I think about (effective altruism - trying to make the world a better place in the most effective ways).
